name: Lahmajoon
author: Jane
summary: The traditional taste of Armenia will be a favorite! These little meat pizzas are usually made with lamb, but beef works just as well.
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, drained and chopped
½ cup finely chopped green bell pepper
directions: In a small bowl, mix active dry yeast, 1 tablespoon sugar and 1/2 cup warm water
In a large bowl, mix flour, salt, 3 tablespoons shortening, remaining sugar, remaining water and the yeast preparation
Use the remaining shortening to remove any dough sticking to the sides of the bowl, and to remove dough from fingers
Cover with a towel and place in a warm location until doubled in size, about 2 to 3 hours
In a medium bowl, mix ground beef, tomatoes, onions, parsley, green bell pepper, salt, cayenne pepper and black pepper
Chill in the refrigerator until ready to use
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Lightly flour a large baking sheet
On a lightly floured surface, form dough into 12 balls
Place balls on the prepared baking sheet
Roll balls into 7 inch diameter circles
Spread approximately 1 1/2 tablespoons meat mixture over each circle
Bake in the preheated oven 15 to 20 minutes, or until beef is no longer pink and dough is lightly browned
